title: Configuring PayPal 'Direct Payment' Payment Processor
description:
Use of Proprietary Information and Copyright Notice. This document contains proprietary information that is to be used only by the Sippy Software, Inc. customers. Any unauthorized disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of this information is prohibited. (c) 2009 Sippy Software, Inc. All rights reserved.


In order to set up PayPal Direct Payment payment processor, PayPal merchant account owner should request special login/password and certificate via PayPal interface. www.paypay.com username/password SHOULD NOT be used for setting up PayPal Direct Payment payment processor, as they won't work.

In addition, unlike with PayPal Express Checkout, there is approval process that has to be completed before the account can be used. More details are available  here .

Once the use of PayPal Direct Payment has been approved, username/password/certificate can be obtained as specified below.

  1. Follow instructions in Configuring PayPal EC Payment Processor to obtain API Username, API Password and download certificate.
  2. Select Payment Processors->Add in the Softswitch, chose PayPal DP as a Payment Gateway.
  3. Use username/password/certificate saved on step above to set up PayPal DP payment processor in the Softswitch.

Detailed instructions on obtaining API username/password and API Certificate can be found here .


Direct Payment processor is deprecated for at least 5 years.
description_text: Use of Proprietary Information and Copyright Notice. This document contains proprietary information that is to be used only by the Sippy Software, Inc. customers. Any unauthorized disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of this information is prohibited. (c) 2009 Sippy Software, Inc. All rights reserved.      In order to set up PayPal Direct Payment payment processor, PayPal merchant account owner should request special login/password and certificate via PayPal interface. www.paypay.com username/password SHOULD NOT be used for setting up PayPal Direct Payment payment processor, as they won't work.  In addition, unlike with PayPal Express Checkout, there is approval process that has to be completed before the account can be used. More details are available  here .  Once the use of PayPal Direct Payment has been approved, username/password/certificate can be obtained as specified below.   Follow instructions in Configuring PayPal EC Payment Processor  to obtain API Username, API Password and download certificate.  Select Payment Processors->Add in the Softswitch, chose PayPal DP as a Payment Gateway.  Use username/password/certificate saved on step above to set up PayPal DP payment processor in the Softswitch.   Detailed instructions on obtaining API username/password and API Certificate can be found here .     Direct Payment processor is deprecated for at least 5 years.

title: DO NOT USE THOSE STEPS UPDATE customer's accounts balance in DB
description:
Если клиент просит проапдейтить баланс аккаунтов которые прендалежат одному кастомеру, это можна сделать след путём:

1. Вам клиент дал список аккаунтов баланс которых нужно обновить:


2. Конвертируем его в csv формат любой удобной вам программой(я это делаю через прогу Convert XLS хотя можно и через excel);

3. awk -F , '{print "UPDATE accounts SET balance = " $12 " WHERE i_account = -" $2 ";"}' /home/root1/file.csv > output.sql в результате этой комманды берётся 2-й и двенадцатый столбики и подставляются в в комманду update. В результате на выходе вы получаете *.sql файл с подставлеными значениями для каждого аккаунта.

Кстати, знак "-" необходим в комманде для того чтобы баланс был положительный на вебе...Иначе он будет отрицательным:)
description_text:
Если клиент просит проапдейтить баланс аккаунтов которые прендалежат одному кастомеру, это можна сделать след путём:
 
 
1. Вам клиент дал список аккаунтов баланс которых нужно обновить:
 
 
  
 
 
2. Конвертируем его в csv формат любой удобной вам программой(я это делаю через прогу Convert XLS хотя можно и через excel);
  
 
3. awk -F , '{print "UPDATE accounts SET balance = " $12 " WHERE 
i_account = -" $2 ";"}' /home/root1/file.csv > output.sql
в результате этой комманды берётся 2-й и двенадцатый столбики и 
подставляются в в комманду update. В результате на выходе вы получаете
*.sql файл с подставлеными значениями для каждого аккаунта.  
 
Кстати, знак "-" необходим в комманде для того чтобы баланс был положительный на вебе...Иначе он будет отрицательным:)

title: Configuring Google Checkout Payment Processor (obsolete)
description:
Use of Proprietary Information and Copyright Notice. This document contains proprietary information that is to be used only by the Sippy Software, Inc. customers. Any unauthorized disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of this information is prohibited. (c) 2006-2011 Sippy Software, Inc. All rights reserved.


In order to set up Google Checkout payment processor you should create merchant account on  Google Checkout Merchant Center. Username and password used to access Google Checkout SHOULD NOT be used for setting up Google Checkout payment processor, as they won't work.


1. Login into  Google Checkout Merchant Center


2. Select Settings tab

3. Select Integration menu

4. Use Merchant ID and Merchant Key to set up Google Checkout payment processor in the Softswitch.

5. Check My company will only post digitally signed carts checkbox.

6. Set up API callback URL. You need to specify a URL that consists from:

   

      http:// + Softswitch_Web_Address + /utils/google_checkout_ + your_Merchant_ID + .php


    E.g.:

  • Web address of your softswitch is 93.74.24.36
  • your Merchant_ID is 762801755099949

         

    then API callback URL is:
       
       http://93.74.24.36/utils/google_checkout_762801755099949.php

    Note!  For test environment (sandbox) use URL like:

       

       http:// + Softswitch_Web_Address + /utils/google_checkout_testing_ + your_Merchant_ID + .php

  

    E.g.:
 
        http://93.74.24.36/utils/google_checkout_testing_762801755099949.php


7. Set Callback contents to Notification Serial Number.

8. Set API Version to Version 2.5

9. Check Notification Filtering checkbox

10. Save the changes

11. If you are going to charge your orders manually in  Google Checkout Merchant Center you can omit steps #6 and #7, but you have to check Manual Charge option in your payment processor (see picture bellow):
description_text: Use of Proprietary Information and Copyright Notice. This document contains proprietary information that is to be used only by the Sippy Software, Inc. customers. Any unauthorized disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of this information is prohibited. (c) 2006-2011 Sippy Software, Inc. All rights reserved.      In order to set up Google Checkout payment processor you should create merchant account on  Google Checkout Merchant Center. Username and password used to access Google Checkout SHOULD NOT be used for setting up Google Checkout payment processor, as they won't work.     1. Login into  Google Checkout Merchant Center     2. Select Settings tab  3. Select Integration menu  4. Use Merchant ID and Merchant Key to set up Google Checkout payment processor in the Softswitch.  5. Check My company will only post digitally signed carts checkbox.  6. Set up API callback URL. You need to specify a URL that consists from:             http:// + Softswitch_Web_Address + /utils/google_checkout_ + your_Merchant_ID + .php         E.g.:   Web address of your softswitch is 93.74.24.36  your Merchant_ID is 762801755099949                  then API callback URL is:                 http://93.74.24.36/utils/google_checkout_762801755099949.php      Note!  For test environment (sandbox) use URL like:                  http:// + Softswitch_Web_Address + /utils/google_checkout_testing_ + your_Merchant_ID + .php          E.g.:            http://93.74.24.36/utils/google_checkout_testing_762801755099949.php     7. Set Callback contents to Notification Serial Number.  8. Set API Version to Version 2.5  9. Check Notification Filtering checkbox  10. Save the changes  11. If you are going to charge your orders manually in  Google Checkout Merchant Center you can omit steps #6 and #7, but you have to check Manual Charge option in your payment processor (see picture bellow):

title: Configuring Cybersource Payment Processor - deprecated starting from 5.0
description:
Use of Proprietary Information and Copyright Notice. This document contains proprietary information that is to be used only by the Sippy Software, Inc. customers. Any unauthorized disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of this information is prohibited. (c) 2006 Sippy Software, Inc. All rights reserved.

In order to set up CyberSource payment processor, CyberSource merchant account owner should request SOAP security key at CyberSource web interface.

  1. Login into  https://ebc.cybersource.com using your CyberSource username/password.
  2. Go into Account Management -> Transaction Security Keys menu.
  3. Select Security Keys for the SOAP Toolkit API.
  4. Generate there your security key, download and save it.
  5. Select Payment Processors -> Add in the SSP, chose CyberSource as a Payment Gateway.
  6. Use your CyberSource username as Username and the key saved on step above as Certificate to set up CyberSource payment processor in the SSP.
description_text:
Use of Proprietary Information and Copyright Notice. This document contains proprietary information that is to be used only by the Sippy Software, Inc. customers. Any unauthorized disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of this information is prohibited. (c) 2006 Sippy Software, Inc. All rights reserved. 
 In order to set up CyberSource payment processor, CyberSource merchant account owner should request SOAP security key at CyberSource web interface. 
 
 Login into  https://ebc.cybersource.com using your CyberSource username/password. 
 Go into Account Management -> Transaction Security Keys menu. 
 Select Security Keys for the SOAP Toolkit API. 
 Generate there your security key, download and save it. 
 Select Payment Processors -> Add in the SSP, chose CyberSource as a Payment Gateway. 
 Use your CyberSource username as Username and the key saved on step above as Certificate to set up CyberSource payment processor in the SSP.

title: External Services
description:
External Services


The existing external rtpproxy set up is not usable for any practical purposes, because all rtp goes in a single thread. The Sippy Media Gateway is the solution for your external media relaying requirements.


External Services is a feature allowing to off-load parts of the traffic processing to separate servers, effectively building a distributed cluster. This feature could be used in order to optimize media path as well as to increase maximum system throughput and make system more robust.

At the moment, only supported external service is media relay, known as RTPproxy and the Sippy Media Gateway.


Adding external media gateway:

  1. Prepare the remote machine.
  • Download RTPproxy at www.rtpproxy.org or use pre-built package for your operating system if available or contact sales@sippysoft.com for the fully supported Sippy Media Gateway.
  • Build and install RTPproxy (skip this step if you are using the pre-built package).
  • Run RTPproxy in the remote control mode using the following command: 

          $ rtpproxy -l <server_ip> -s udp:<server_ip>:<control_port> -F -L 19999


       Where <server_ip> is an IP address of the machine that will be used to run RTPproxy on, and <control_port> is UDP port

       number that the RTPproxy will use to listen for connections from the Sippy Softswitch.


     2. Add corresponding External Service entry on Sippy Softswitch, setting up Service Type to RTPproxy, Hostname to   

        <server_ip> and Port to <control_port>.

     3. Assign the newly created RTPproxy external service as Preferred Media Relay in connections and routing groups. The  

        system will monitor connectivity between the softswitch and external media proxy and fall back to using internal one if the 

        connection fails for some reason.

     4. It also recommended that you configure firewall to only allow UDP packets originated from Sippy Softswitch to be passed to

        the RTPproxy, as RTPproxy doesn't have any access control functionality on itself, where the Sippy Media Gateway does.
description_text:
External Services     The existing external rtpproxy set up is not usable for any practical purposes, because all rtp goes in a single thread. The Sippy Media Gateway is the solution for your external media relaying requirements.   External Services is a feature allowing to off-load parts of the traffic processing to separate servers, effectively building a distributed cluster. This feature could be used in order to optimize media path as well as to increase maximum system throughput and make system more robust.  At the moment, only supported external service is media relay, known as RTPproxy and the Sippy Media Gateway.     Adding external media gateway:   Prepare the remote machine.   
 Download RTPproxy at www.rtpproxy.org or use pre-built package for your operating system if available or contact sales@sippysoft.com for the fully supported Sippy Media Gateway.
 
 Build and install RTPproxy (skip this step if you are using the pre-built package). 
 Run RTPproxy in the remote control mode using the following command:  
            $ rtpproxy -l <server_ip> -s udp:<server_ip>:<control_port> -F -L 19999          Where <server_ip> is an IP address of the machine that will be used to run RTPproxy on, and <control_port> is UDP port         number that the RTPproxy will use to listen for connections from the Sippy Softswitch.          2. Add corresponding External Service entry on Sippy Softswitch, setting up Service Type to RTPproxy, Hostname to             <server_ip> and Port to <control_port>.       3. Assign the newly created RTPproxy external service as Preferred Media Relay in connections and routing groups. The            system will monitor connectivity between the softswitch and external media proxy and fall back to using internal one if the           connection fails for some reason.       4. It also recommended that you configure firewall to only allow UDP packets originated from Sippy Softswitch to be passed to          the RTPproxy, as RTPproxy doesn't have any access control functionality on itself, where the Sippy Media Gateway does.
